result.execSummary:
The defendant Travian L Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant shall pay outstanding GPS fees to Racine County Alternatives Program.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent including cognitive intervention. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3.5 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.  Obtain GED or HSED.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant Travian L Gardner in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Victim notification accomplished.  State requests adjournment of plea until after 09/27.  Defendant is witness in another case.  State will not oppose release from house arrest to allow for job  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Letter to Defendant RE: Bond Monitoring

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, JR (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
AMENDED 09/02/16   DEFENDANT MAY HAVE RELEASE FROM HOUSE ARREST FOR JOB INTERVIEWS AND EMPLOYMENT, IF OBTAINED.  PRIOR NOTICE MUST BE GIVEN TO MONITORING AGENCY.
Plea hearing on September 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
